alert.note: Alert for Hancock; McDonough (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 04 at 6:25PM CDT until April 04 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Hancock County in west central Illinois... Southern McDonough County in west central Illinois... * Until 700 PM CDT. * At 625 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Bowen, or 14 miles south of Carthage, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Augusta and Hancock County Fairgrounds around 630 PM CDT. Plymouth around 640 PM CDT. Colmar around 645 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Tennessee, Fandon, Colchester, Argyle Lake State Park, Macomb, Western Illinois University, Spring Lake and McDonough County 4-H Grounds. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for west central Illinois. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for west central Illinois.
